definitions.definition: to sit on an animal, especially a horse, and control it as it moves

examples.text: I learnt to ride as a child.
They rode along narrow country lanes.
He was riding on a large black horse.
He **rode** fifty miles **on horseback**.
to **ride a horse**
to ride a pony/ donkey/camel
She had never ridden a horse before.
He's ridden six winners so far this year *(= in horse racing)*.
At the end of the film they ride off into the sunset.
They rode hard all night.
We were riding along a dusty trail.
riding bareback on a circus horse

definitions.definition: to spend time riding a horse for pleasure

examples.text: How often do you go riding?

definitions.definition: to sit on and control a bicycle, motorcycle, etc.

examples.text: The boys were **riding their bikes** around the streets.
He rode a Harley Davidson.
It 's like **riding a bicycle**: one day you can't and the next day you can.
The ground there is too rough to ride over.

definitions.definition: to travel in a vehicle, especially as a passenger

examples.text: I walked back while the others rode in the car.
to ride a train/the subway/an elevator
She **rode the bus** to school every day.
The widow and children rode in the first car after the coffin.
The men loaded my stuff onto the pick-up and I rode with them in the cab.
He rides the subway every day.
You could ride right along the coast by tram.

definitions.definition: to float or be supported on water or air

examples.text: We watched the balloon riding high above the fields.
The ship was **riding at anchor** in the harbour.
surfers riding the waves
A large bird was riding the air currents beneath it.

definitions.definition: to go through or over an area on a horse, bicycle, etc.

examples.text: We rode the mountain trails.

definitions.definition: to criticize or tease somebody in an annoying way

examples.text: Why is everybody riding me today?

definitions.definition: to be doing something that involves risks and that may end in disaster
to be successful or very confident

examples.text: The company is riding high this year.

definitions.definition: wishing for something does not make it happen
to decide to do nothing about a problem that you know you may have to deal with later

examples.text: He was rude to me but I let it ride this time.

definitions.definition: to enjoy great success or support because of a particular situation or event

examples.text: The band is riding the crest of its last tour.

definitions.definition: to keep watch or control over somebody/something

examples.text: police riding herd on crowds of youths on the streets

definitions.definition: to treat somebody badly and not worry about their feelings
to ride in the front passenger seat of a car or truck
to enjoy or be supported by the particular situation or quality mentioned

examples.text: Schools are riding a wave of renewed public interest.

wordOrigin: Old English rīdan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch rijden and German reiten.
